Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class PlayerBoard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.PlayerBoard
public class PlayerBoard
extends java.lang.Object
This class represent a player's personal board

    • discardFromTemporaryDeposit

      @Deprecated public void discardFromTemporaryDeposit​(Resource resource) throws InvalidResourceSelectedException
      Deprecated.
      this function doesn't have a reason to exist anymore.
      For each call all the players move of one step except this player
      Parameters:
      resource - type of Resource to be discarded from temporary deposit
      Throws:
      InvalidResourceSelectedException

    • tryAddResources

      public java.util.HashMap<Resource,​java.lang.Integer> tryAddResources​(java.util.HashMap<Resource,​java.lang.Integer> resources)
      try add this resource s to the player's deposit. It prioritizes the card leader deposit
      Parameters:
      resources - HashMap to be added
      Returns:
      Resources to be added (this is less or equal the input resources and represents the resources after adding the maximum amount to the leader's deposit), null if all the resources have been added

    • tryAddMarbles

      @Deprecated public boolean tryAddMarbles​(java.util.ArrayList<Marble> marbles)
      Deprecated.
      Use consumeMarbles(ArrayList) and tryAddResources(HashMap)instead
      Resets the Temporary Deposit and tries to add the given arraylist of marbles
      Parameters:
      marbles - to be added
      Returns:
      True if action has succeeded, False otherwise

    • hasResources

      public boolean hasResources​(java.util.HashMap<Resource,​java.lang.Integer> numberOfResources)
      Checks if strongbox and deposit COMBINED hold enough resources as specified in the param numberOfResources
      Parameters:
      numberOfResources - A HashMap of the amounts to be met in order to return true
      Returns:
      true if strongbox + deposit hold enough resources, false otherwise

    • activateBasicProduction

      private void activateBasicProduction​(Resource input1, Resource input2, Resource output)
      Giving two resources you can get one of any type This method assumes that the player holds enough resources to activate the production power.
      Parameters:
      input1 - first resource used as input for basic production power
      input2 - second resource used as input for basic production power
      output - output of basic production power

    • activateCardProduction

      private void activateCardProduction​(CardDevelopmentSlot cardDevelopmentSlotToActivate)
      Method to activate a single card's production power. This method assumes that the player holds enough resources to activate the production power.
      Parameters:
      cardDevelopmentSlotToActivate - slot whose highest production power is to be activated

    • activateLeaderProduction

      public void activateLeaderProduction​(CardLeader cardLeaderToBeActivated, Resource output)
      Checks if cardLeader can be activated and calls activate() on it This method assumes that the player holds enough resources to activate the production power.
      Parameters:
      cardLeaderToBeActivated - card leader production whose power is to be activated
      output - type of Resource to be produced

      Throws:
      NotEnoughResourcesException
      java.util.EmptyStackException

    • placeCardDevelopmentCardOnBoard

      public void placeCardDevelopmentCardOnBoard​(CardDevelopment cardToBePlaced, int cardSlotIndex) throws InvalidCardDevelopmentPlacementException, FullSlotException, InvalidSlotIndexException
      Throws:
      InvalidCardDevelopmentPlacementException
      FullSlotException
      InvalidSlotIndexException

    • tryActivateProductions

      public boolean tryActivateProductions​(ProductionSelection productionSelection) throws InvalidSlotIndexException, CardLeaderRequirementsNotMetException
      Method to try and activate a selection of production powers. The method first computes the total cost of activation for the selected powers, and if the player holds enough resources, it activates them.
      Parameters:
      productionSelection - class that contains the user selections
      Returns:
      true if player has enough resources to activate powers, false otherwise
      Throws:
      InvalidSlotIndexException - - thrown if an index not in range [0, 2] is selected
      CardLeaderRequirementsNotMetException

    • getFaithTrailPosition

      public java.lang.Integer getFaithTrailPosition()
